page.title: 01Change in Frimley Green
page.content: Frimley Green is mentioned in the {Domesday Book.}This area was originally farming, woodlands and heathland. Each farm had its own farmhouse and many still exist today, built as long as 400 years ago. Those still standing are preserved by their owners but the surrounding land has been built on at an alarming rate during the past 30 years. Also RAOC HQ is based on heathland for army training and barracks. The Worsley Road Estate, built as an experiment in 1958, has three types of housing. Several large estates have since been erected. At present houses are being constructed on many remaining open spaces. Houses of various types are provided to suit all needs. Commuters find the area suitable as the M3 motorway is close by.
